name: Shoulder Dislocates
how_to_perform:
1. Start by lying on your back with your arms extended overhead and your legs in a table-top position, with your hands under your shoulders.
2. Place a resistance band or cable over the highest point of your shoulder so that it is directly above your armpit.

3. Slowly begin to lift your arm straight up and outwards, keeping the cable or resistance band taut throughout the movement.

4. Continue lifting until your fist can barely touch the ceiling.

5. Hold for a brief moment to emphasize contraction.

6. Lower your arm back down to the starting position without releasing tension on the cable or resistance band throughout the movement.

7. Repeat on the other side.
short_summary: Shoulder dislocates are an upper body exercise that works the shoulders, targeting the supraspinatus and trapezius muscles.
